titles: A booke which sheweth the life and manners of all true Christians and howe vnlike they are vnto Turkes and Papistes, and heathen folke. Also the pointes and partes of all diuinitie, that is of the reuealed will and worde of God are declared by their seuerall definitions and diuisions in order as followeth. Also there goeth a treatise before of reformation without tarying for anie, and of the wickednesse of those preachers, which will not refourme them selues and their charge, because they will tarie till the magistrate commanude and compell them. By me, Robert Brovvne.
author: Browne, Robert, ca. 1550-1633.
publisher: Imprinted by Richarde Painter [i.e. Richard Schilders],
notes: "A booke which sheweth the life and manners of all true Christians" has separately dated title page and register.
A different state of the edition collating A-B⁴ C²  D-H⁴; A-O⁴. Quire D contains a different version of the preface to part 2, ending on D2v.
Identified as STC 3910 on reel 180, and STC 3910+ on reel 214.
